text: That would be a really nice addition

Hello everyone, I am quite new to HubSpot CMS. I have started a new job where I am tasked with reorganizing and structuring their website. I’ve read through the docs regarding theme, templates, and modules. I have also connected the cms-cli. My problem is that it appears they are currently using no theme (is that possible?). What I mean by that, is that all the templates, modules, etc are simply scattered throughout the root directory, and are not contained in any theme folder. (See image). So as a test, I pushed the boiler-plate theme from my local machine. However, when I go to a page, the templates found in this boiler-plate theme are not available. Does the whole site have to adopt a theme before a template from the theme can be used?
For example, if content editor goes to where the Design options are for the theme it gives this message.

Hey there, it’s likely your company’s website was built before we introduced themes.

Yes it’s possible to have templates and modules outside of a theme, that actually used to be the only way to do it.

When creating a page and selecting a template, there is a link that says something along the lines of “other templates” this is where templates not associated with a theme live.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/add-theme-features-to-existing-sites|You can retroactively make templates and modules apart of a theme>, though the biggest benefit of themes comes from designing templates, modules, styles etc around being part of a theme.

So you can get some of the benefits on an older site, but the experience will be better starting from the ground up with everything built as a theme.
Thank you <@U7SL518D6>, this is exactly the information I needed. I appreciate you taking the time to reply in such detail.
